@graph.caption: Chinese Orange Chicken that is better than take-out. How to make ORANGE CHICKEN at home with a sweet orange sauce. www.modernhoney.com

@graph.name: Chinese Orange Chicken – Modern Honey
@graph.description: Chinese Orange Chicken made at home is way better than take-out. Crispy fried chicken with a sweet and tangy orange sauce. The perfect orange chicken recipe

@graph.headline: Chinese Orange Chicken
@graph.description: Chinese Orange Chicken that is way better than take-out!
recipeIngredient: 4  Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts (cut into bite-size pieces)
2 Tablespoons Soy Sauce (use tamari for a gluten-free dish)
1/4 teaspoon Garlic Powder (or 2 garlic cloves, finely diced)

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium pot, add orange juice, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and red chili flakes. Heat for 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium pot, add orange juice, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and red chili flakes. Heat for 3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, whisk 1 Tablespoon of cornstarch with 2 Tablespoons of water to form a paste. Add to orange sauce and whisk together. Continue to cook for 5 minutes, until the mixture begins to thicken. Once the sauce is thickened, remove from heat and add orange zest.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, whisk 1 Tablespoon of cornstarch with 2 Tablespoons of water to form a paste. Add to orange sauce and whisk together. Continue to cook for 5 minutes, until the mixture begins to thicken. Once the sauce is thickened, remove from heat and add orange zest.

recipeInstructions.text: Place flour and cornstarch in a shallow dish or pie plate. Add a pinch of salt. Stir.
recipeInstructions.name: Place flour and cornstarch in a shallow dish or pie plate. Add a pinch of salt. Stir.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture and then flour mixture. Place on plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture and then flour mixture. Place on plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2 -3 inches of oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Using a thermometer, watch for it to reach 350 degrees.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 2 -3 inches of oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Using a thermometer, watch for it to reach 350 degrees.

recipeInstructions.text: Working in batches, cook several chicken pieces at a time. Cook for 2 - 3 minutes, turning often until golden brown. Place chicken on a paper-towel-lined plate. Repeat.
recipeInstructions.name: Working in batches, cook several chicken pieces at a time. Cook for 2 - 3 minutes, turning often until golden brown. Place chicken on a paper-towel-lined plate. Repeat.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss chicken with orange sauce. You may reserve some of the sauce to place on rice. Serve it with a sprinkling of green onion and orange zest, if so desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss chicken with orange sauce. You may reserve some of the sauce to place on rice. Serve it with a sprinkling of green onion and orange zest, if so desired.
